com.linecorp.armeria.client

Interface ClientRequestContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeMap, RequestContext
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientRequestContextWrapper, DefaultClientRequestContext

    public interface ClientRequestContext
extends RequestContext
    Provides information about a Request, its Response and its related utilities. Every client request has its own ClientRequestContext instance.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static AttributeKey<HttpHeaders> HTTP_HEADERS
      The AttributeKey of the HttpHeaders to include when a Client sends an HttpRequest.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Endpoint endpoint()
      Returns the remote Endpoint of the current Request.
      String fragment()
      Returns the fragment part of the URI of the current Request, as defined in the section 3.5 of RFC3986.
      long maxResponseLength()
      Returns the maximum length of the received Response.
      ClientOptions options()
      Returns the ClientOptions of the current Request.
      long responseTimeoutMillis()
      Returns the amount of time allowed until receiving the Response completely since the transfer of the Response started.
      void setMaxResponseLength(long maxResponseLength)
      Sets the maximum length of the received Response.
      void setResponseTimeout(Duration responseTimeout)
      Sets the amount of time allowed until receiving the Response completely since the transfer of the Response started.
      void setResponseTimeoutMillis(long responseTimeoutMillis)
      Sets the amount of time allowed until receiving the Response completely since the transfer of the Response started.
      void setWriteTimeout(Duration writeTimeout)
      Sets the amount of time allowed until sending out the current Request completely.
      void setWriteTimeoutMillis(long writeTimeoutMillis)
      Sets the amount of time allowed until sending out the current Request completely.
      long writeTimeoutMillis()
      Returns the amount of time allowed until sending out the current Request completely.

    • Field Detail

      • HTTP_HEADERS

        static final AttributeKey<HttpHeaders> HTTP_HEADERS
        The AttributeKey of the HttpHeaders to include when a Client sends an HttpRequest. This Attribute is initially populated from ClientOption.HTTP_HEADERS and can be modified by a DecoratingClient.

    • Method Detail

      • endpoint

        Endpoint endpoint()
        Returns the remote Endpoint of the current Request.

      • options

        ClientOptions options()
        Returns the ClientOptions of the current Request.

      • fragment

        String fragment()
        Returns the fragment part of the URI of the current Request, as defined in the section 3.5 of RFC3986.
        Returns:
        the fragment part of the request URI, or an empty string if no fragment was specified

      • writeTimeoutMillis

        long writeTimeoutMillis()
        Returns the amount of time allowed until sending out the current Request completely. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_WRITE_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.

      • setWriteTimeoutMillis

        void setWriteTimeoutMillis(long writeTimeoutMillis)
        Sets the amount of time allowed until sending out the current Request completely. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_WRITE_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.

      • setWriteTimeout

        void setWriteTimeout(Duration writeTimeout)
        Sets the amount of time allowed until sending out the current Request completely. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_WRITE_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.

      • responseTimeoutMillis

        long responseTimeoutMillis()
        Returns the amount of time allowed until receiving the Response completely since the transfer of the Response started. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.

      • setResponseTimeoutMillis

        void setResponseTimeoutMillis(long responseTimeoutMillis)
        Sets the amount of time allowed until receiving the Response completely since the transfer of the Response started. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.

      • setResponseTimeout

        void setResponseTimeout(Duration responseTimeout)
        Sets the amount of time allowed until receiving the Response completely since the transfer of the Response started. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.

      • maxResponseLength

        long maxResponseLength()
        Returns the maximum length of the received Response. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_MAX_RESPONSE_LENGTH.
        See Also:
        ContentTooLargeException

      • setMaxResponseLength

        void setMaxResponseLength(long maxResponseLength)
        Sets the maximum length of the received Response. This value is initially set from ClientOption.DEFAULT_MAX_RESPONSE_LENGTH.
        See Also:
        ContentTooLargeException
